en_us.figura.docs: The "/figura docs" command allows you to access documentation for all types and functions Figura adds to its Lua scripting environment
en_us.figura.docs.enum: Contains all specific string values used in other functions
en_us.figura.docs.enum.empty: There is no values in this enumerator!
en_us.figura.docs.enum.keybinds:
List of valid keybind keys
Used within the KeybindAPI
en_us.figura.docs.enum.parent_types:
List of valid ParentTypes
Used within ModelParts
en_us.figura.docs.enum.render_types:
List of valid RenderTypes
Used within ModelParts
en_us.figura.docs.enum.texture_types:
List of valid TextureTypes
Used within ModelParts
en_us.figura.docs.enum.key_ids:
List of valid KeyIDs
Used within the KeybindAPI
en_us.figura.docs.enum.entity_poses:
List of valid EntityPoses
Used within the EntityAPI
en_us.figura.docs.enum.item_display_modes:
List of valid DisplayModes
Used within the Item RenderTask
en_us.figura.docs.enum.post_effects:
List of valid PostEffects
Used within the RendererAPI
en_us.figura.docs.enum.play_states:
List of valid PlayStates
Used within Blockbench animations
en_us.figura.docs.enum.loop_modes:
List of valid LoopModes
Used within Blockbench animations
en_us.figura.docs.enum.colors:
List of custom colors
Used anywhere you can input a hex color
en_us.figura.docs.enum.player_model_parts:
List of valid PlayerModelParts
Used within the PlayerAPI
en_us.figura.docs.enum.use_actions:
List of valid UseActions
Used within the ItemStackAPI
en_us.figura.docs.enum.render_modes:
List of valid RenderModes
Used within the RENDER event
en_us.figura.docs.globals: Documentation for the various things Figura adds to the global lua state
en_us.figura.docs.globals.require:
The require() function takes the name of one of your scripts, without the .lua extension
If this script has not been already run before, it will run that script and return the value that script returns
If it has been run before, then it will not run the file again, but it will return the same thing as the first time
If a required script has no returns, then require() will return true
If the name you give isn't any of your scripts, it will error
en_us.figura.docs.globals.list_files:
A function that returns a table with all script file names from the specified path
If no path is specified, it will fetch from the root folder
A second argument, boolean, can be given to also list files inside subfolders
en_us.figura.docs.globals.type:
Figura overrides lua's type() function
When used on Figura types, returns the type's name as seen in the docs and in the figuraMetatables global
When called on a table that has a metatable with a __type key, returns the corresponding value
en_us.figura.docs.globals.print:
A function that writes its arguments to chat
Even though the syntax says only one argument, you can put as many as you want
All of them will print, and they'll be separated by a tab space
Returns the string representation of all values
en_us.figura.docs.globals.print_table:
The first argument is either a Table, or it's a Userdata, which refers to any of the added Figura types
Prints the table out to chat, specially formatted
If userdata is passed in, it is automatically converted to a table or string, and displayed
In the case of tables inside of tables, the "maxDepth" parameter will be used to determine how far to go
Default value for maxDepth is 1
Third argument, "silent", will skip the chat print and will only return the string
en_us.figura.docs.globals.print_json:
Takes a Minecraft json string as an argument, and prints it to the chat formatted, without the lua print header
Even though the syntax says only one argument, you can put as many as you want
All of them will print, and they'll be appended in the end of the previous argument
Returns the formatted string
en_us.figura.docs.globals.parse_json:
Takes a json string as an argument, and converts it into a lua value.
Objects and arrays are converted to tables appropriately.
en_us.figura.docs.globals.to_json:
Takes any lua value, and converts it into a json string.n
Does not accept functions, they will be treated as null.
en_us.figura.docs.globals.action_wheel: The global instance of the ActionWheelAPI and its subtypes
en_us.figura.docs.globals.animations: The global instance of the AnimationsAPI and its subtypes
en_us.figura.docs.globals.figura_metatables:
A table containing all the metatables for Figura's object types
The metatables are editable

en_us.figura.docs.math: Contains functions which Figura adds to the default Lua "math" library table
en_us.figura.docs.math.player_scale: The constant of the player scaling related to the world
en_us.figura.docs.math.world_scale: The constant of the world scaling related with the player
en_us.figura.docs.math.lerp:
Linearly interpolates from its first argument to its second argument, with the third argument as the parameter
Works on both regular numbers, vectors of the same type and matrices of the same type
en_us.figura.docs.math.clamp: Clamps the given value between min and max
en_us.figura.docs.math.round: Rounds the given number to the nearest whole integer
en_us.figura.docs.math.map:
Maps the given value from one range to another
For example, if you have a value of 20 in the range 0-200, and you want to map it to the range 100-200, the result will be 110
en_us.figura.docs.math.short_angle:
Returns the shortest angle between two angles
For example, if you have an angle of 350 degrees and you want to get the shortest angle between it and 0 degrees, the result will be 10 degrees
en_us.figura.docs.math.lerp_angle:
Similar to the default lerp function, but numbers are limited to the range of 0-360
Lerp is done towards the shortest angle
For example, a lerp of 340 and 20, with factor of 0.75, will return 10
en_us.figura.docs.math.sign:
Returns the sign of the given number
Returns 1 if the number is positive, -1 if it's negative, and 0 if it's 0
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel: A global API which is used for customizing your player's Action Wheel
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.left_click: Function that is executed when the left mouse button is clicked
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.right_click: Function that is executed when the right mouse button is clicked
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.scroll: Function that is executed when the mouse is scrolled
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.execute:
Executes the action of the given index
If the index is null, it will execute the last selected action
A second parameter can be given to specify if it should be executed the left or right action
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.is_enabled: Returns if the Action Wheel is being currently rendered or not
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.get_selected: Returns the index of the currently selected action
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.get_selected_ac: Returns the Action that is currently selected in the Action Wheel
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.new_action: Creates a new Action that is not automatically asigned to a Page
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.new_page:
Creates a new Page for the action wheel
A Title can be given to store this page internally
If no Title is given, the Page will just be returned from this function
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.set_page: Sets the Page of the action wheel to the given Title or Page
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.get_page:
Returns an stored Page by the given title
If no title is given, returns a table with all registered Pages
en_us.figura.docs.action_wheel.get_current_pag: Returns the current set Page from the Action Wheel, or NIL if no Page has been set
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page: An Action Wheel container which is used to store up to 8 actions
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.keep_slots: Whether or not this page's current slots should be reset when adding this page on the Action Wheel
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.should_keep_slots: Gets if this page's current slots should be reset when adding this page on the Action Wheel
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.set_keep_slots: Sets if this page's current slots should be reset when adding this page on the Action Wheel
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.get_title: Returns the title of this Page
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.new_action:
Adds a new Action on the selected Page's index
If no index is given it is added in the first available index
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.get_action: Gets an Action from the Page's given index
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.set_action:
Sets an Action in the Page's given index
If index is -1, the action will be set in the latest empty index
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.get_slots_shift:
Gets this page's current slots shift
This value is the current shown slots, divided by 8, rounded up
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.set_slots_shift:
Sets this page's current slots shift
The value is the current shown slots, divided by 8, rounded up
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_page.get_actions:
Gets a table of the Actions shifted by the given number
If no shift is specified, it returns all Actions from this page
Note that the table is indexed as its slot number as key, so blank slots will result in nil values
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action:
An action in the Figura Action Wheel
Actions are either interacted by clicking and scrolling, which also being able to be toggleable
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.left_click:
Function that is executed when the left mouse button is clicked
The function have one argument
The first argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.right_click:
Function that is executed when the right mouse button is clicked
The function have one argument
The first argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.toggle:
Function that is executed when the Action is toggled
The function have two arguments
The first argument is toggle state of this action
The second argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.untoggle:
Function that is executed when the Action is untoggled
The function have two arguments
The first argument is toggle state of this action
The second argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.scroll:
Function that is executed when the mouse is scrolled
The function have two arguments
The first argument is mouse wheel direction
The second argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_title: Sets the title of the Action
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_color: Sets the color of the Action
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_hover_color: Sets the color of the Action when it is being hovered
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_item: Sets the item of the Action
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_hover_item: Sets the item of the Action when it is being hovered
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_texture:
Sets a Custom Texture to render in this Action
All values are measured in pixels
Default UV is 0, 0, the default dimensions are the texture dimensions and the default scale of 1
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_hover_textu:
Sets a Custom Texture to render while this Action is being hovered
All values are measured in pixels
Default UV is 0, 0, the default dimensions are the texture dimensions and the default scale of 1
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_on_left_cli:
Sets the function that is executed when the left mouse button is clicked
The function have one argument
The first argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_on_right_cl:
Sets the function that is executed when the right mouse button is clicked
The function have one argument
The first argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_on_toggle:
Sets the function that is executed when the Action is toggled
The function have two arguments
The first argument is toggle state of this action
The second argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_on_untoggle:
Sets the function that is executed when the Action is untoggled
The function have two arguments
The first argument is toggle state of this action
The second argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_on_scroll:
Sets the function that is executed when the mouse is scrolled
The function have two arguments
The first argument is mouse wheel direction
The second argument is this action itself
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_toggle_titl: Sets the title of the Action when it is toggled
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_toggle_colo: Sets the color of the Action when it is toggled
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_toggle_item: Sets the item of the Action when it is toggled
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_toggle_text:
Sets a Custom Texture to render in this Action when it is toggled
All values are measured in pixels
Default UV is 0, 0, the default dimensions are the texture dimensions and the default scale of 1
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.is_toggled: Checks if the Action is toggled or not
en_us.figura.docs.wheel_action.set_toggled: Sets the toggle state of the Action
en_us.figura.docs.animations: A global API used for control of Blockbench Animations
en_us.figura.docs.animations.get_animations: Returns a table with all animations
en_us.figura.docs.animations.get_playing: Return a table with all playing animations
en_us.figura.docs.animation.name: This animation's name
en_us.figura.docs.animation.animation.is_playi: Checks if this animation is being played
en_us.figura.docs.animation.animation.is_pause: Checks if this animation is paused
en_us.figura.docs.animation.animation.is_stopp: Checks if this animation is stopped
en_us.figura.docs.animation.play:
Initializes the animation
Resume the animation if it was paused
en_us.figura.docs.animation.restart:
Restarts the animation
Plays the animation if it was stopped
This behaviour can also be reproduced by stopping then playing the animation
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_playing:
A function that merges "play" and "stop" together
Takes a boolean parameter, where if true, the animation will play, and when false, the animation will stop
en_us.figura.docs.animation.get_time: Get the animation's playback current time
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_time: Sets the animation's playback current time
en_us.figura.docs.animation.new_code:
Adds a string to run in a determinant time
If theres already code to run at that time, it is overridden
en_us.figura.docs.animation.get_blend: Gets the animation's keyframe blend factor
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_blend: Sets the animation's keyframe blend factor
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_offset:
Sets how much time to skip for the animation
The time is skipped on every loop
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_start_delay:
Set how much time to wait before this animation is initialized
Note that while it is waiting, the animation is considered being played
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_loop_delay: Set how much time to wait in between the loops of this animation
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_length: Set the animation's length, in seconds
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_override:
Set if this animation should override all of its parts vanilla transforms
Equivalent of calling "overrideRot", "overridePos" and "overrideScale" altogether
en_us.figura.docs.animation.get_override_rot: Gets if this animation should override its parts vanilla rotation
en_us.figura.docs.animation.get_override_pos: Gets if this animation should override its parts vanilla position
en_us.figura.docs.animation.get_override_scale: Gets if this animation should override its parts vanilla scale
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_override_rot: Set if this animation should override its parts vanilla rotation
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_override_pos: Set if this animation should override its parts vanilla position
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_override_scale: Set if this animation should override its parts vanilla scale
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_priority:
Sets the animation's priority
Instead of blending, low priority animations are overridden by high priority ones
en_us.figura.docs.animation.set_speed:
Sets the animation's playback speed
Negative numbers can be used for an inverted animation
en_us.figura.docs.avatar: A global API containing functions to interact with your avatar's metadata, and also to get information about the current script environment
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.store:
Store the given key-value pair inside your current avatar's metadata
Someone else can get this information from a different script with the avatarVars() function in World
The key must be a string
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_uuid: Returns the UUID of the owner of this avatar
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_current_instructi:
Gets the current number of instructions that have been executed by your avatar
Resets to 0 at the beginning of certain events
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_color: Gets the current color string of your avatar, used as your avatar theme
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.set_color: Sets the current color string of your avatar, used as your avatar theme
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_version: Gets the version string of this avatar
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_authors: Gets the authors string of this avatar
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_name: Gets the name string of this avatar
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_entity_name: Attempts to get the entity name of this avatar, defaulting to the avatar name
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_size: Gets the file size of this avatar in bytes
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.has_texture: Gets whether or not this avatar has a texture
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.has_script_error: Gets whether this script currently has stopped due to an error (kinda useless lol)
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_permission_level: Returns this avatar current permission level
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_init_count: Gets the number of initialization instructions of this avatar
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_entity_init_count: Gets the number of events.ENTITY_INIT instructions of this avatar
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_init_count: Gets the maximum allowed instructions during initialization as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_tick_count: Gets the number of events.TICK instructions of this avatar last tick
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_tick_count: Gets the maximum allowed instructions in events.TICK as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_render_count: Gets the number of events.RENDER and events.POST_RENDER instructions of this avatar last frame
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_render_count: Gets the maximum allowed instructions in events.RENDER and Events.POST_RENDER as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_world_tick_count: Gets the number of events.WORLD_TICK instructions of this avatar last tick
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_world_tick_co: Gets the maximum allowed instructions in events.WORLD_TICK as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_world_render_coun: Gets the number of events.WORLD_RENDER and events.POST_WORLD_RENDER instructions of this avatar last frame
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_world_render_: Gets the maximum allowed instructions in events.WORLD_RENDER and events.POST_WORLD_RENDER as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_complexity: Gets the current complexity of this avatar
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_complexity: Gets the maximum allowed model complexity (number of faces) as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_remaining_particl: Gets the remaining amount of particles this avatar can summon
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_particles: Gets the maximum allowed number of particles as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_remaining_sounds: Gets the remaining amount of sound this avatar can play
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_sounds: Gets the maximum allowed number of sounds as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_animation_complex: Gets the current animation complexity of this avatar
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_animation_com: Gets the maximum allowed animation complexity (number of playing channels) as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_animation_count: Gets the number of Lua instructions used within animations
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_animation_cou: Gets the maximum allowed Lua instructions in animations as permitted by the viewer
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_max_texture_size: Gets the max dimensions of custom textures that this avatar can create
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.can_edit_vanilla_mode: Gets whether or not the viewer allows your avatar to edit the vanilla models
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.can_edit_nameplate: Gets whether or not the viewer allows your avatar to edit your nameplate
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.can_render_offscreen: Gets whether or not the viewer allows you to render the avatar off-screen
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.can_use_custom_sounds: Gets whether or not the viewer allows your avatar to play custom sounds
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.can_have_custom_skull: Gets whether or not your avatar is allowed to have custom player skull
en_us.figura.docs.avatar.get_nbt: Gets the NBT data this avatar is stored as
en_us.figura.docs.biome:
A proxy for a Minecraft biome
Instances are obtained through the WorldAPI
This proxy also contains a saved position for the Biome
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_id: Returns the id of this biome
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_pos:
Returns the saved position for this Biome's proxy
The saved position is used in Biome functions that require a position
en_us.figura.docs.biome.set_pos:
Sets the saved position for this Biome's proxy
The saved position is used in Biome functions that require a position
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_tags: Gets the worldgen related tags from this Biome
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_temperature: Gets the temperature of this biome
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_precipitation:
Gets the rain type of this biome
The type can be "NONE", "RAIN" or "SNOW"
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_sky_color: Gets this biome's sky color as a RGB vector
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_foliage_color: Gets this biome's foliage color as a RGB vector
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_grass_color: Gets this biome's grass color as a RGB vector
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_fog_color: Gets this biome's fog color as a RGB vector
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_water_color: Gets this biome's water color as a RGB vector
en_us.figura.docs.biome.get_water_fog_color: Gets this biome's water fog color as a RGB vector
en_us.figura.docs.biome.is_hot: Checks if this biome is hot
en_us.figura.docs.biome.is_cold: Checks if this biome is cold
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate:
A proxy for a block state from Minecraft
Instances are obtained through the WorldAPI
This proxy also contains a saved position for the BlockState
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.id: The identifier of the block this BlockState comes from
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.properties:
A table containing the properties of this BlockState
If this BlockState has no properties, it is nil
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_properties: Returns a table with the properties of this BlockState
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_pos:
Returns the saved position for this BlockState proxy
The saved position is used in BlockState functions that require a position
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.set_pos:
Sets the saved position for this BlockState proxy
The saved position is used in BlockState functions that require a position
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.is_translucent: Gets whether or not the BlockState would propagate sky light downwards
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_opacity: Gets the opacity of the BlockState, in terms of how much it affects light levels
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_map_color: Gets the map color of this BlockState, as a Vector3 with R,G,B ranging 0 to 1
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.is_solid_block: Gets whether or not the BlockState is considered a "solid" block by Minecraft
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.is_full_cube: Gets whether or not the BlockState has a full cube as its collision hitbox
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.has_emissive_ligh: Gets whether or not the BlockState uses emissive lighting
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_hardness: Gets the hardness of the BlockState
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_comparator_ou: Gets the amount of signal strength a comparator would get from this BlockState
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.has_block_entity: Gets whether or not this BlockState has an associated block entity
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.is_opaque: Gets whether or not this BlockState is opaque
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.emits_redstone_po: Gets whether or not this BlockState emits redstone power
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_luminance: Gets the emission light level of this BlockState
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_friction:
Gets the friction of this BlockState
(Slime blocks and ice in vanilla)
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_velocity_mult:
Gets the velocity multiplier of this BlockState
(Only Soul sand, honey blocks in vanilla)
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_jump_velocity:
Gets the jump velocity multiplier of this BlockState
(Literally just honey blocks in vanilla)
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_blast_resista: Gets the blast resistance of this BlockState
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.as_item:
Returns an ItemStack representing this block in item form, whatever Minecraft deems that to be
If it cannot find an item for this block, it will return nil
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_tags: Returns a table containing all the tags of this block, as strings
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.has_collision: Returns true if this block has collision
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_collision_sha:
Returns a table representing the bounding boxes of the collision shape
The table a list of every shape, containing two Vector3, where the first vector is one corner of the box and the other vector is the other corner
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_outline_shape:
Returns a table representing the bounding boxes of the outline shape
The table a list of every shape, containing two Vector3, where the first vector is one corner of the box and the other vector is the other corner
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_sounds:
Gets the names of all the sounds which can play from this BlockState, as well as their pitch and volume
Stored in a table
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_fluid_tags: Returns a table containing all the fluid tags of this block, as strings
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_entity_data:
Returns the nbt of the Block Entity associated with this BlockState, at its position, as a table
Since the mod is only on client side, this NBT might not actually contain the real nbt, which is stored server-side
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.to_state_string: Converts this BlockState into a string, like you'd see in a Minecraft command
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.get_textures:
Returns a List of this BlockState's textures
The keys represents the Culling Direction, while the values is another table with all texture paths (string)
Note this only work for normal blocks, special blocks (water, beds, ...) will return an empty table
en_us.figura.docs.blockstate.is_air: Checks if this block is air
en_us.figura.docs.client:
A global API used to interact with the current Minecraft client
Most of its functions return things that can be found in the F3 menu
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_fps:
Gets the FPS of the client
Returns 0 if the fps counter isn't ready yet (or if your pc is just that bad)
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_fps_string:
Gets the FPS string of the client, displayed in the F3 menu
Contains info on the fps, the fps limit, vsync, cloud types, and biome blend radius
en_us.figura.docs.client.is_paused: Returns true if the client is paused
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_version: Returns the Minecraft version of your client
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_version_name: Returns the extended name of the Minecraft version of your client
en_us.figura.docs.client.is_snapshot: Returns if the client is running a snapshot or full release version
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_client_brand: Returns the "version type" of your client, usually the client modloader brand
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_server_brand:
Returns the type of server you're on
In singleplayer, this is "Integrated"
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_chunk_statistics:
Returns a string containing information about the player's chunk
This string appears in the F3 menu
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_entity_statistics:
Returns a string containing information about the loaded entities on the client
This string appears in the F3 menu
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_sound_statistics:
Returns a string containing information about the currently playing sounds on the client
This string appears in the F3 menu
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_entity_count: Returns the number of currently loaded entities
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_particle_count: Returns the number of currently loaded particles
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_current_effect:
Returns the path to the currently applied shader, used when spectating an entity that has different vision than normal
Normally returns nil
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_java_version: Returns your current Java version you're playing Minecraft with
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_used_memory: Returns the number of bytes of memory Minecraft is currently using
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_max_memory: Returns the maximum amount of memory that Minecraft will try to use
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_allocated_memory: Returns the maximum amount of memory that Minecraft can possibly use
en_us.figura.docs.client.is_window_focused: Returns true if the Minecraft window is currently focused
en_us.figura.docs.client.is_hud_enabled: Returns true if the hud is enabled (F1 disables the HUD)
en_us.figura.docs.client.is_debug_overlay_enab: Returns true if the F3 screen is currently open
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_window_size: Returns the size of the Minecraft window in pixels, as {width, height}
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_fov: Returns the current FOV option of the client, not including additional effects such as speed or sprinting
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_system_time: Returns the current system time in milliseconds
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_mouse_pos: Returns the position of the mouse in pixels, relative to the top-left corner
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_scaled_window_siz: Returns the size of the window in Minecraft's interal GUI units
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_gui_scale:
Returns the current value of your Gui Scale setting
If you use auto, then it gets the actual current scale
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_camera_pos: Returns the position of the viewer's camera
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_camera_rot: Returns the rotation of the viewer's camera
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_camera_dir: Returns a unit vector pointing in the direction that the camera is facing
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_text_width:
Returns the width of the given text in pixels
In case of multiple lines, return the largest width of all lines
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_text_height: Returns the height of the given text in pixels
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_text_dimensions: Returns the width and height of the given text, wrapping lines and trimming to a max width
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_active_lang: Returns a string representation of the current game language
en_us.figura.docs.client.is_mod_loaded: Checks if the client have loaded the given mod ID
en_us.figura.docs.client.has_iris: Checks if the client has the Iris mod installed
en_us.figura.docs.client.has_iris_shader: Checks if the client is currently using an Iris shader
en_us.figura.docs.client.has_resource: Checks if the specific resource exists withing the client resources
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_active_resource_p: Returns a table with the active resource pack names
en_us.figura.docs.client.compare_versions: Compares two versions if they are less than (-1), equals (0) or greater than (1)
en_us.figura.docs.client.int_uuid_to_string: Converts an int array UUID (as 4 separated arguments) into its hexadecimal string representation
en_us.figura.docs.client.uuid_to_int_array: Converts a string UUID into its int array representation, returning a varargs of 4 ints
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_viewer: Returns the player entity from the running client
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_camera_entity: Returns the entity the camera is currently targeting, so returns the entity you are currently spectating, including yourself
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_server_data: Returns a table with information of the current connected server (also for singleplayer worlds)
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_date: Returns a table with information about the client current time
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_frame_time:
Returns the current fraction between the last tick and the next tick
This is the value used as "delta" in the RENDER event
en_us.figura.docs.client.list_atlases: Returns a list of all registered atlases paths
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_atlas:
Returns a TextureAtlasAPI object with information about the given atlas
Returns nil if the atlas was not found
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_tab_list: Returns a table with the text shown in the tablist
en_us.figura.docs.client.get_translated_string:
Returns the translated string of the given key
Translation is done using the current client language
Optionally take a single argument, or a list with all arguments, that will populate the translation
en_us.figura.docs.config: A global API used to save and load avatar data between game sessions
en_us.figura.docs.config.get_name: Returns the name of the destination file
en_us.figura.docs.config.set_name:
Sets the name of the destination file, data will be saved and loaded from that file
Defaults to the avatar name
en_us.figura.docs.config.save:
Save to disk a variable under the specific key
If the value is nil, the variable is removed from the file
en_us.figura.docs.config.load:
Loads a saved variable under the specific key
If no key is given, it will return a table with all saved variables
en_us.figura.docs.entity: Acts as a proxy for an entity in the Minecraft world
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_loaded:
Checks if this entity object is still being updated and loaded
A non loaded entity would be someone who is in another dimension or out of the render distance for example
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_pos:
Gets the position of the entity in the world
If delta is passed in, then it will be used to linearly interpolate the position of the entity between the previous tick and the current tick
The default value of delta is 1
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_rot:
Gets the rotation of the entity in degrees
If delta is passed in, then it will be used to linearly interpolate the rotation of the entity between the previous tick and the current tick
The default value of delta is 1
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_uuid: Gets the UUID of the proxied entity
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_type:
Gets the Minecraft identifier of this entity
For instance, "minecraft:pig"
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_cute: Checks if this entity is cute
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_velocity: Gets the current velocity of this entity in world coordinates, calculated as its position this tick minus its position last tick
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_look_dir:
Returns a unit vector pointing in the direction that this entity is looking
See the blue line in the F3+B screen for an example
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_frozen_ticks: Gets the number of ticks this entity has been freezing in powder snow for
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_max_air: Gets the maximum amount of air this entity can have
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_dimension_name: Gets the Minecraft identifier of the dimension this entity is in
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_pose:
Returns the current pose of the player
This can be one of: "STANDING", "FALL_FLYING", "SLEEPING", "SWIMMING", "SPIN_ATTACK", "CROUCHING", "LONG_JUMPING", or "DYING"
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_vehicle:
Returns a proxy for the entity that this player is currently riding
If the player isn't riding anything, returns nil
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_on_ground: Returns whether or not this entity is currently on the ground
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_eye_height: Returns the current eye height of this entity
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_bounding_box:
Returns the size of this entity's bounding box as a Vector3
{x, y, z} are the width, height, and width
Minecraft entity hitboxes always have square bases
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_name:
Gets the name of this entity, if it has a custom name
If it doesn't, returns a translated form of getType()
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_wet:
Returns true in any of three conditions: if the entity is in water, if the entity is in rain, or if the entity is in a bubble column
Otherwise, returns false
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_in_water: Returns true if this entity is currently in a water block, including waterlogging
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_underwater: Returns true if this entity's eyes are touching water
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_in_lava: Returns true if this entity is currently in lava
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_in_rain: Returns true if this entity is currently standing in rain
en_us.figura.docs.entity.has_avatar: Returns true if Figura has an avatar loaded for this entity
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_sprinting: Returns true if this entity is currently sprinting
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_eye_y:
Returns the Y level of this entity's eyes
Not to be confused with getEyeHeight, this function also takes the entity itself's Y position into account
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_glowing: Returns true if this entity is currently glowing
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_invisible: Returns true if this entity is invisible, for one reason or another
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_silent: Returns true if this entity is silent
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_sneaking: Returns true if this entity is logically sneaking (can't fall from blocks edges, can't see nameplate behind walls, etc)
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_crouching: Returns true if this entity is visually sneaking
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_item:
Gets an ItemStack for the item in the given slot
For the player, slots are indexed with 1 as the main hand, 2 as the off hand, and 3,4,5,6 as the 4 armor slots from the boots to the helmet
If an invalid slot number is given, this will return nil
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_nbt:
Gets a table containing the NBT of this entity
Please note that not all values in the entity's NBT may be synced, as some are handled only on server side
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_on_fire: Returns true if this entity is currently on fire
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_alive: Returns whether this entity is alive or not
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_permission_level:
Returns the permission level number of this entity
Server Operators, by default, have the permission level of 4
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_passengers: Returns a List of entities of all passengers this entity have
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_controlling_passe: Returns the entity that is controlling this entity
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_controlled_vehicl: Return the vehicle that this entity is controlling
en_us.figura.docs.entity.has_container: Checks if the entity has a container (Chest Boats, Minecarts with Chests, ...)
en_us.figura.docs.entity.has_inventory: Checks if the entity has an inventory (Horses, Camels, LLamas, ...)
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_targeted_block:
Returns a proxy for your currently targeted BlockState
This BlockState appears on the F3 screen
Maximum and Default distance is 20, Minimum is -20
Returns a vararg of the block, the hit position and the block face the hit collided
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_targeted_entity:
Returns a proxy for your currently targeted Entity
This Entity appears on the F3 screen
Maximum and Default distance is 20, Minimum is 0
en_us.figura.docs.entity.get_variable: Gets the value of a variable this entity stored in themselves using the Avatar api's store() function
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_living: Gets if this entity is a Living Entity
en_us.figura.docs.entity.is_player: Gets if this entity is a Player Entity
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity: Acts as a proxy for a living entity in the Minecraft world
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_body_yaw:
Gets the yaw of this entity's body in degrees
If delta is passed in, then it will be used to linearly interpolate the rotation of the body between the previous tick and the current tick
The default value of delta is 1
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_held_item:
Returns an ItemStack representing the item in this entity's main hand
If true is passed in for "offhand", then it will instead look at the item in the entity's offhand
If the entity isn't holding an item in that hand, returns air
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_active_ite:
Returns an ItemStack representing the item the entity is currently using
If they're not using any item, returns air
Returns the ticks this entity's active item has been used for
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_health: Returns the amount of health this entity has remaining
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_max_health: Returns the maximum amount of health this entity can have
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_armor: Returns the amount of armor points this entity has
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_death_time: Returns the number of ticks this entity has been dead for
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_arrow_coun: Returns the number of arrows sticking out of this entity
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_stinger_co: Returns the number of bee stingers sticking out of this entity
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.is_left_handed: Returns true if the entity's main hand is its left
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.is_using_item: Returns true if the entity is currently using an item
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_active_han: Returns "OFF_HAND" or "MAIN_HAND", depending on which hand this entity uses an item with
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.is_climbing: Returns true if the entity is currently using a climbable block, like a ladder or vine
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_swing_time: Returns the number of ticks this entity has the arm swinging
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.is_swinging_ar: Returns true if the entity is currently swinging its arm
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_swing_arm: Returns "OFF_HAND" or "MAIN_HAND", based on the arm this entity is currently swinging
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_swing_dura: Returns the number of ticks this entity will have while swinging its arms
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_absorption: Returns the amount of this entity's absorption (yellow hearts)
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.is_sensitive_t: Returns if this entity takes damage to water
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.get_entity_cat:
Returns the category of this entity
The categories are: "ARTHROPOD", "UNDEAD", "WATER", "ILLAGER" and by default, "UNDEFINED"
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.is_gliding: Returns if this entity is gliding with an elytra
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.is_blocking: Return if this entity is blocking with a shield
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.is_visually_sw: Returns if this entity have the swimming pose
en_us.figura.docs.living_entity.riptide_spinni: Returns if this entity is riptide spinning
en_us.figura.docs.player:
Acts as a proxy for a player entity in the Minecraft world
A global instance exists for the avatar's user, under the name "player"
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_food: Gets the current food level of the player, from 0 to 20
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_saturation: Gets the current saturation level of the player
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_exhaustion: Gets the current exhaustion level of the player
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_experience_progre: Gets the progress of the way towards the player's next level, as a value from 0 to 1
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_model_type: Returns "SLIM" or "DEFAULT", depending on the player's model type
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_gamemode:
Returns "SURVIVAL", "CREATIVE", "ADVENTURE", or "SPECTATOR" depending on the player's gamemode
If the gamemode is unknown, returns nil
en_us.figura.docs.player.has_cape: Returns whether the player has a cape loaded
en_us.figura.docs.player.has_skin: Returns whether the player has a custom skin loaded
en_us.figura.docs.player.is_skin_layer_visible: Returns whether the specified skin layer, from the Skin Customizations settings, is currently visible
en_us.figura.docs.player.is_fishing: Returns if the player is currently fishing
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_charged_attack_de: Returns the delay (in ticks) of charged attacks
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_shoulder_entity: Returns a table of the nbt of this entity left or right shoulder entity
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_team_info:
Returns a table with information about the team of this player
Returns nil if the player doesnt have a team
en_us.figura.docs.player.get_cooldown_percent:
Returns the whether a given ItemStack has an active cool down as a percent from 0.0 to 1.0
If it has none, it returns 0.0
Takes two parameters stack, and delta, delta offsets the cooldown's tick count by it, used for smoother animation.
en_us.figura.docs.viewer: An extension of the Player, used for the viewer only, meant as proxy to allow access to some host only functions
en_us.figura.docs.events:
A global API that contains all of the figura Events
Accessed using the name "events"
en_us.figura.docs.events.entity_init: The ENTITY_INIT event is run once this avatar's entity exists
en_us.figura.docs.events.tick: The TICK event is run every tick in-game if this avatar's entity exists
en_us.figura.docs.events.world_tick: The WORLD_TICK event is run every in-game tick
en_us.figura.docs.events.render:
The RENDER event is run every frame, before the avatar is rendered
Takes a parameter delta, which is a number from 0 to 1 indicating the proportion of the way the game is between ticks
A second parameter, giving out context of the current RenderMode, with is a string with the name of the source of this render event
And a third paramenter, being the source matrix used to render the Avatar
en_us.figura.docs.events.post_render:
The POST_RENDER event runs every frame, after the avatar is rendered
Takes a parameter delta, which is a number from 0 to 1 indicating the proportion of the way the game is between ticks
A second parameter, giving out context of the current RenderMode, with is a string with the name of the source of this render event
And a third paramenter, being the source matrix used to render the Avatar
en_us.figura.docs.events.world_render:
The WORLD_RENDER event is run every frame, before the world is rendered
Always runs when a world is visible, even when the avatar itself is not, so this runs even in first person
Takes a parameter delta, which is a number from 0 to 1 indicating the proportion of the way the game is between ticks
en_us.figura.docs.events.post_world_render:
The POST_WORLD_RENDER event runs every frame, after the world is rendered
Always runs when a world is visible, even when the avatar itself is not, so this runs even in first person
Takes a parameter delta, which is a number from 0 to 1 indicating the proportion of the way the game is between ticks
en_us.figura.docs.events.chat_send_message:
The CHAT_SEND_MESSAGE event is run every time you send a message in chat
A string parameter is passed in, which contains the message that was sent
The return value is chained to the next events of the same type, whereas NIL cancels the message from being sent and any other value will modify the sent message (if allowed in the settings)
en_us.figura.docs.events.chat_receive_message:
The CHAT_RECEIVE_MESSAGE event is run every time a message is received in chat
The first argument is the raw string of the received text
The second argument is a JSON string representation of the received text
If the first return value is not nil, the message will be replaced with that value
If the first return value is false, it will suppress adding this message
The second return value is, optionally, a RGB vector which will be used as background color for this message
en_us.figura.docs.events.skull_render:
Called on every one of your skull blocks placed in the world
It have 5 arguments, as listed below:
(number) - the tick delta
(blockstate) - the block, when rendered from a block
(itemstack) - the item, when rendered from an item
(entity) - the entity, when rendered from a entity
(string) - the type of the rendering (LEFT_HAND, HEAD, BLOCK, ...)
If the return value is true, the skull will not render
en_us.figura.docs.events.mouse_scroll:
The MOUSE_SCROLL event runs every time the mouse is scrolled
Takes a parameter delta, which is the direction of the scroll
If returned true, the event cancels its vanilla function
en_us.figura.docs.events.mouse_move:
The MOUSE_MOVE event runs every time the mouse is moved around
Takes two parameters, x and y, which is the difference from the mouse position based on the latest saved position
If returned true, the event cancels its vanilla function
Note that cancelling the vanilla function also cancels saving the last mouse position
en_us.figura.docs.events.mouse_press:
The MOUSE_PRESS event runs every time a mouse button is pressed
Takes three number parameters, a "button", which is the number id of the button that was been pressed, the "action", which is the status of the press event (0 for release, 1 for press, 2 for hold), and the "modifier", which is a bitmask number detecting if you have any modifier keys being pressed (like shift or alt, for example)
If returned true, the event cancels its vanilla function
en_us.figura.docs.events.key_press:
The KEY_PRESS event runs every time a keyboard key is pressed
Takes three number parameters, a "key", which is the number id of the key that was been pressed, the "action", which is the status of the press event (0 for release, 1 for press, 2 for hold), and the "modifier", which is a bitmask number detecting if you have any modifier keys being pressed (like shift or alt, for example)
If returned true, the event cancels its vanilla function
en_us.figura.docs.events.char_typed:
The CHAR_TYPED event runs every time a character is inputted
Takes three parameters, the resulting "string" after converting the code point, the "modifier", which is a bitmask number detecting if you have any modifier keys being pressed (like shift or alt, for example), and the "codepoint" of the inputted char
en_us.figura.docs.events.use_item:
The USE_ITEM event is run every time the entity uses an item
The item, action and amount of particles this item would produce is given as argument
If returned true, the event cancels its vanilla function
en_us.figura.docs.events.arrow_render:
The ARROW_RENDER event is run for every arrow entity shot by the Avatar owner
It takes two arguments, the tick delta, and the arrow entity
Returning "true" stops this arrow from rendering, including the Arrow parent parts
Requires the "Vanilla Model Change" permission
en_us.figura.docs.events.item_render:
Called on every one of your items that is being rendered
It takes six arguments, the item, the rendering mode, the position, rotation and scale that it would be applied, and if its being rendered from the left hand
Returning a ModelPart parented to Item, stops the rendering of this item and will render the returned part instead
en_us.figura.docs.events.on_play_sound:
Called every time a new sound is played
Take as arguments, the sound ID, its world position, volume, pitch, if the sound should loop, the sound category, and the sound file path
en_us.figura.docs.events.resource_reload: Called every time that the client resources are reloaded, allowing you to re-create or update resource texture references
en_us.figura.docs.events.get_events: Returns a table with all events types
en_us.figura.docs.event:
A hook for a certain event in Minecraft
You may register functions to one, and those functions will be called when the event occurs
en_us.figura.docs.event.register:
Register a function on this event
Functions are run in registration order
An optional string argument can be given, grouping functions under that name, for an easier management later on
en_us.figura.docs.event.clear: Clears the given event of all its functions
en_us.figura.docs.event.remove:
Removes either a function from this event, or when given a string, remove all functions registred under that name
Returns the number of functions that were removed
en_us.figura.docs.event.get_registered_count: Returns a number of how many functions is registered by this name
en_us.figura.docs.host:
A global API dedicated to specifically the host of the avatar
For other viewers, these do nothing
en_us.figura.docs.host.unlock_cursor: Setting this value to true will unlock your cursor, letting you move it freely on the screen instead of it controlling your player's rotation
en_us.figura.docs.host.is_host: Returns true if this instance of the script is running on host
en_us.figura.docs.host.is_cursor_unlocked:
Checks if the cursor is currently unlocked
Only responds to your own changes in script, not anything done by Minecraft
en_us.figura.docs.host.set_unlock_cursor: Toggles locking of your cursor, letting you move it freely on the screen instead of it controlling your player's rotation
en_us.figura.docs.host.set_title_times: Sets the duration of the title on the screen, also its fade-in and fade-out durations
en_us.figura.docs.host.clear_title: Clears the current title from the GUI
en_us.figura.docs.host.set_title:
Sets the current title to the given text
The text is given as json
en_us.figura.docs.host.set_subtitle:
Sets the current subtitle to the given text
The text is given as json
en_us.figura.docs.host.set_actionbar:
Sets the action bar message to the given text
The boolean parameter defaults to false
en_us.figura.docs.host.send_chat_message: Sends the given message in the chat
en_us.figura.docs.host.send_chat_command: Sends the given command in the chat
en_us.figura.docs.host.append_chat_history: Appends the message on the recent chat history
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_chat_message:
Returns a table with information about a chat message
Takes an index, were 1 means the last message on chat
en_us.figura.docs.host.set_chat_message:
Modifies a chat message with the given text
Takes an index, were 1 means the last message on chat
Setting the message to nil will effectively remove it from the chat
en_us.figura.docs.host.swing_arm:
Animates swinging the player's arm
If the boolean is true, then the offhand is the one that swings
en_us.figura.docs.host.is_first_person: Returns true if the camera is in first person mode
en_us.figura.docs.host.is_camera_backwards: Returns true if the camera is facing backwards
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_slot:
Gets an ItemStack for the item in the given slot
The slot is either their numerical id (0 indexed) or the slot string, as used in the /item command
en_us.figura.docs.host.set_slot:
Sets a slot with an ItemStack
The slot is either their numerical id (0 indexed) or the slot string, as used in the /item command
Slot -1 uses the first available slot
Only runs for creative mode
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_chat_color: Gets the chat window text color
en_us.figura.docs.host.set_chat_color: Sets the color of the text that is currently being typed into the chat window
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_chat_text: Gets the text that is currently being typed into the chat window
en_us.figura.docs.host.set_chat_text: Sets the text currently being typed in the chat window to the given string
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_screen:
Gets the class name of the screen the player is currently on
If the player is not currently in a screen, returns nil
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_screen_slot_count:
Gets the number of slots in the screen the player is currently in
If the player is not currently in a screen or the screen has no slots, returns nil
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_screen_slot:
Gets the item in a screen slot
The slot is either their numerical id (0 indexed) or the slot string, as used in the /item command
If the player is not currently in a screen, the screen has no slots, or the slot index is greater than the maximum, returns nil
en_us.figura.docs.host.is_chat_open: Checks if the host has the chat screen opened
en_us.figura.docs.host.is_container_open: Checks if the host has a container screen opened
en_us.figura.docs.host.screenshot: Takes a screenshot from the current screen and returns a Texture of it
en_us.figura.docs.host.is_avatar_uploaded: Checks if this avatar is currently uploaded
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_status_effects:
Returns a table of all of the player's status effects
The table contains sub-tables, each of which contains the name, amplifier, duration, and particle visibility of each status effect
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_clipboard: Gets the text from the clipboard
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_attack_charge:
Returns a fraction (0 to 1) of the charge of the player attack
If less than 1, every attack will result result in a weak attack
en_us.figura.docs.host.is_jumping:
Checks if the player is jumping
Note this is only true during the first tick the player started jumping
en_us.figura.docs.host.is_flying: Checks if the player is currently flying
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_reach_distance: Returns the current reach distance of the player
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_air: Gets the remaining amount of air of the player
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_pick_block:
Returns the current targeted block set by the client
Returns a vararg of the block, the hit position and the block face the hit collided
en_us.figura.docs.host.get_pick_entity: Returns the current targeted entity set by the client
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack: A proxy for an item stack from Minecraft
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.id: Contains the id of the item this ItemStack refers to
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.tag:
A table containing the NBT tag of this ItemStack
If this ItemStack has nothing in its tag, it is nil
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_id: Gets the ID of this stack
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_tag: Gets a table of the NBT tags of this stack
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_count: Gets the number of items in this stack
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_damage:
Gets the damage value of the item in this stack
Works on things like tools, or other things with a durability bar
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_pop_time: Gets the item's animation bobbing time, in ticks. This value is used to move an item to the player when it is picked up
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.has_glint: Returns true if this item glows with enchantment glint
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_tags: Gets all the tags of this item as strings in a table
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.is_block_item: Returns true if this item represents a block
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.is_food: Returns true if this item is edible
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_use_action: Returns the name of the animation that plays when using this item
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_name: Gets the name of the item
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_max_count: Gets the maximum stack size of this item
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_rarity:
Gets the rarity of this item stack
COMMON = white, UNCOMMON = yellow, RARE = aqua, EPIC = light purple
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.is_enchantable: Returns true if this item stack can be put in an enchanting table
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_max_damage: Gets the maximum durability of this item stack
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.is_damageable: Returns true if this item stack has durability
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.is_stackable: Returns true if the item is stackable
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_repair_cost: Gets the repair cost modifier, in an anvil, for this item stack
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_use_duration:
Gets the number of ticks needed to "use" this item
Currently only has a use for food items
Always 32 for food items except kelp, which is 16
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.to_stack_string: Converts this ItemStack to a string, like you'd see in a command
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.is_armor: Checks if this item is a Armor
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.is_tool: Check if this item is a Tool (Axe, Shovel, Pickaxe, ...)
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_equipment_slot: Returns the slot name of where this item is used
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.copy: Returns a copy of this item stack
en_us.figura.docs.itemstack.get_blockstate:
Returns the blockstate representation of this item stack
If this item has no block representation, returns nil
en_us.figura.docs.keybinds: A global API containing a function to create new Keybind instances
en_us.figura.docs.keybinds.new_keybind:
Creates and returns a new Keybind
The name is used in the keybind menu
The key parameter is an identifier for a key, such as "key.keyboard.r"
The boolean gui indicates whether the keybind should always work, or if it should only work when you don't have a screen open
Check the docs enum command for all key names
en_us.figura.docs.keybinds.from_vanilla: Creates a new Keybind based from a vanilla key
en_us.figura.docs.keybinds.get_vanilla_key:
Gets the id of the key bound to the given action, as a string
Check the docs enum command for all key names and vanilla actions
en_us.figura.docs.keybinds.get_keybinds: Returns a table with all registered keybinds
en_us.figura.docs.keybind:
Represents a key binding for your script
Instances are obtained using the KeybindAPI's create() function
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.press:
A function that runs when the key is pressed down
The function have two arguments
The first argument is a number, meaning the modifiers bitmask
Shift = 1, Ctrl = 2, Alt = 4
The second argument is this keybind itself
If the return value is true then all vanilla keybinds using same key will be ignored
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.release:
A function that runs when the key is released
The function have two arguments
The first argument is a number, meaning the modifiers bitmask
Shift = 1, Ctrl = 2, Alt = 4
The second argument is this keybind itself
If the return value is true then all vanilla keybinds using same key will be ignored
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.set_on_press:
Sets the function that is executed when this key is pressed
The function have two arguments
The first argument is a number, meaning the modifiers bitmask
Shift = 1, Ctrl = 2, Alt = 4
The second argument is this keybind itself
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.set_on_release:
Sets the function that is executed when this key is released
The function have two arguments
The first argument is a number, meaning the modifiers bitmask
Shift = 1, Ctrl = 2, Alt = 4
The second argument is this keybind itself
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.set_key: Sets the key for this keybind
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.is_default: Checks whether this key is currently set to its default state (not been changed using the keybind menu)
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.get_key: Gets the current key for this keybind
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.get_key_name: Gets the name of the current key for this keybind
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.get_name: Gets the name of the keybind, which you set when you created the keybind
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.get_id: Returns the numeric ID of this keybind
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.is_pressed: Gets whether this keybind is currently pressed down
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.is_enabled: Returns if this keybind is enabled or not
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.set_enabled: Toggles if this keybind should be processed or not
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.is_gui_enabled: Returns if this keybind should work when a GUI screen (Chat, Inventory, etc) is open or not
en_us.figura.docs.keybind.set_gui: Set whenever or not this keybind should run when a GUI screen is open
en_us.figura.docs.matrices:
A global API which provides functions dedicated to creating and otherwise manipulating matrices
Accessed using the name "matrices"
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.mat2:
Creates a Matrix2 using the given parameters as columns
If you call the function with no parameters, returns the 2x2 identity matrix
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.mat3:
Creates a Matrix3 using the given parameters as columns
If you call the function with no parameters, returns the 3x3 identity matrix
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.mat4:
Creates a Matrix4 using the given parameters as columns
If you call the function with no parameters, returns the 4x4 identity matrix
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.rotation2:
Creates a new Matrix2 that rotates by the specified angle
Angle is given in degrees
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.rotation3:
Creates a new Matrix3 that rotates by the specified angles
Angles are given in degrees, and the rotation order is ZYX
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.x_rotation3:
Creates a new Matrix3 that rotates by the specified angle around the X axis
Angle is given in degrees
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.y_rotation3:
Creates a new Matrix3 that rotates by the specified angle around the Y axis
Angle is given in degrees
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.z_rotation3:
Creates a new Matrix3 that rotates by the specified angle around the Z axis
Angle is given in degrees
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.rotation4:
Creates a new Matrix4 that rotates by the specified angles
Angles are given in degrees, and the rotation order is ZYX
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.x_rotation4:
Creates a new Matrix4 that rotates by the specified angle around the X axis
Angle is given in degrees
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.y_rotation4:
Creates a new Matrix4 that rotates by the specified angle around the Y axis
Angle is given in degrees
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.z_rotation4:
Creates a new Matrix4 that rotates by the specified angle around the Z axis
Angle is given in degrees
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.scale2: Creates a new Matrix2 that scales by the specified factors
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.scale3: Creates a new Matrix3 that scales by the specified factors
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.scale4: Creates a new Matrix4 that scales by the specified factors
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.translate4: Creates a new Matrix4 that translates by the specified offset
en_us.figura.docs.matrices.translate3: Creates a new Matrix3 that translates by the specified offset
en_us.figura.docs.matrix2: A matrix with 2 rows and 2 columns
en_us.figura.docs.matrix3: A matrix with 3 rows and 3 columns
en_us.figura.docs.matrix4: A matrix with 4 rows and 4 columns
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.copy: Creates and returns a new copy of this matrix
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.get_column:
Gets the given column of this matrix, as a vector
Indexing starts at 1, as usual
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.get_row:
Gets the given row of this matrix, as a vector
Indexing starts at 1, as usual
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.set:
Sets this matrix to have the same values as the matrix passed in
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.multiply:
Multiplies this matrix by the other matrix, with the other matrix on the left
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.right_multiply:
Multiplies this matrix by the other matrix, with the other matrix on the right
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.transpose:
Transposes this matrix, changing the values inside
Transposing means to swap the rows and the columns
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.transposed:
Returns a copy of this matrix, but transposed
Transposing means to swap the rows and the columns
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.invert:
Inverts this matrix, changing the values inside
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.inverted: Returns a copy of this matrix, but inverted
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.det: Calculates and returns the determinant of this matrix
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.reset:
Resets this matrix back to the identity matrix
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.add:
Adds the other matrix to this one
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.sub:
Subtracts the other matrix from this one
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.scale:
Scales this matrix by the specified amount, changing the values inside
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.translate:
Translates this matrix by the specified amount, changing the values inside
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.rotate_x:
Rotates this matrix around the X axis by the specified number of degrees
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.rotate_y:
Rotates this matrix around the Y axis by the specified number of degrees
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.rotate_z:
Rotates this matrix around the Z axis by the specified number of degrees
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.rotate:
Rotates this matrix by the specified amount, changing the values inside
Angles are given in degrees
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.deaugmented: Deaugments this matrix, removing a row and column
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.augmented:
Augments this matrix, adding an additional row and column
Puts a 1 along the diagonal in the new spot, and the rest are zero
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.apply: Treats the given values as a vector, augments this vector with a 1, multiplies it against the matrix, and returns a deaugmented vector of the first values
en_us.figura.docs.matrix_n.apply_dir: Treats the given values as a vector, augments this vector with a 0, multiplies it against the matrix, and returns a deaugmented vector of the first values
en_us.figura.docs.model_part:
Represents a node in the model tree, basically a group/cube/mesh in Blockbench
Each bbmodel file is itself a ModelPart, and all of your models are contained in a global ModelPart called "models"
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.pre_render: Function to run before this part starts being rendered
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.mid_render: Function to run during the middle of this part's rendering, after its matrices are calculated
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.post_render: Function to run after this part and its children is rendered
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_pre_render: Sets a function to run before this part starts being rendered
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_mid_render: Sets a function to run during the middle of this part's rendering, after its matrices are calculated
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_post_render: Sets a function to run after this part and its children is rendered
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_name: The name of this model part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_parent:
Gets the parent part of this part
If this part has no parent, returns nil
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_children: Gets the children of this part, stored in a table
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.is_child_of: Checks if this part is a child of the given part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_pos:
Gets the position of the model part, as an offset from its position in blockbench
Only changes from {0,0,0} when you call setPos()
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_pos:
Sets the position offset for this part from its blockbench position
Nil values for position are assumed to be 0
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_anim_pos: Gets the position offset provided by the currently active animation of this model part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_true_pos: Gets the true position of this model part, which is a sum of the position and the animation position
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_rot:
Gets the rotation of the model part, including its rotation in blockbench
For relative rotation values, check out the "offset" rot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_rot:
Sets the absolute rotation for this part
Nil values for rotation are assumed to be 0
Angles are given in degrees
For relative rotation values, check out the "offset" rot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_offset_rot:
Gets the offset rotation of the model part, offset from its rotation in blockbench
For absolute rotation values, check out the non-offset rot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_offset_rot:
Sets the offset rotation for this part
Nil values for rotation are assumed to be 0
Angles are given in degrees
For absolute rotation values, check out the non-offset rot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_anim_rot: Gets the rotation offset provided by the currently active animation of this model part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_true_rot: Gets the true rotation of this model part, which is a sum of the rotation, the offset rotation and the animation position
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_scale:
Gets the scale of the model part, as a multiple of its blockbench size
Only changes from {1,1,1} when you call setScale()
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_scale:
Sets the scale factor for this part
Nil values for scale are assumed to be 1
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_offset_scale::
Gets the offset scale of the model part, offset from its default scale
For absolute scale values, check out the non-offset rot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_offset_scale::
Sets the offset scale for this part
Nil values are assumed to be 1
For absolute scale values, check out the non-offset rot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_anim_scale: Gets the scale multiplier provided by the currently active animation of this model part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_true_scale: Gets the true scale of this model part, which is a sum of the scale, the offset scale and the animation scale
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_pivot:
Gets the pivot point of the model part, including its pivot in blockbench
For relative values, check out the "offset" pivot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_pivot:
Sets the absolute pivot for this part
Nil values are assumed to be 0
For relative pivot offsets, check out the "offset" pivot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_offset_pivot:
Gets the offset pivot of the model part, offset from its pivot in blockbench
For absolute pivot point values, check out the non-offset pivot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_offset_pivot:
Sets the offset pivot point for this part
Nil values are assumed to be 0
For absolute pivot point values, check out the non-offset pivot functions
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_true_pivot: Gets the true pivot of this model part, which is a sum of the pivot and the offset pivot
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_position_matr: Recalculates the matrix for this model part, based on its current position, rotation, scale, and pivot, then returns this matrix

Returns the position matrix for this model part
The Raw version of the function is different in that it doesn't recalculate the matrix before getting it
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_normal_matrix: Recalculates the normal matrix for this model part, based on its current position, rotation, scale, and pivot, then returns this matrix

Returns the normal matrix for this model part
The Raw version of the function is different in that it doesn't recalculate the matrix before returning it
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_matrix:
Sets the given matrix as the position matrix for this model part
The normal matrix is automatically calculated as the inverse transpose of this matrix
Calling this DOES NOT CHANGE the values of position, rot, or scale in the model part
If you call setPos() or a similar function, the effects of setMatrix() will be overwritten
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_visible:
Gets whether or not this model part is visible
The default value is nil, meaning it copies the visibility of its parent part during rendering
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_visible:
Sets this part to be visible or invisible
The default value is nil, meaning the part copies its visibility from its parent part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_primary_rende:
Gets the current primary render type of this model part
Nil by default, meaning the part copies the primary render type of its parent
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_secondary_ren:
Gets the current secondary render type of this model part
Nil by default, meaning the part copies the secondary render type of its parent
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_primary_rende:
Sets the current primary render type of this model part
Nil by default, meaning the part copies the primary render type of its parent during rendering
Check the docs enum command for all render types
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_secondary_ren:
Sets the current secondary render type of this model part
Nil by default, meaning the part copies the secondary render type of its parent during rendering
Check the docs enum command for all render types
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_primary_textu:
Sets the primary texture override of this part
Check the TextureType types in the list docs
If using "resource", the second parameter should indicate the path to the Minecraft texture you want to use
If using "custom", the second parameter should indicate a texture object
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_secondary_tex:
Sets the secondary texture override of this part
Check the TextureType types in the list docs
If using "resource", the second parameter should indicate the path to the Minecraft texture you want to use
If using "custom", the second parameter should indicate a texture object
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_textures:
Returns a table with all textures used by this part
Do not include children textures, so groups usually will return an empty table
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.part_to_world_mat:
Gets a matrix which transforms a point from this part's position to a world location
Recommended to use this in POST_RENDER, as by then the matrix is updated
In RENDER it will be 1 frame behind the part's visual position for that frame
Also, if the model is not rendered in-world, the part's matrix will not be updated
Paperdoll rendering and other UI rendering will not affect this matrix
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_texture_size:
Gets the width, height of this part's texture in pixels
Throws an error if this part has multiple different-sized textures on it, or if the part is a Group
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_uv:
Sets the UV of this part
This function is normalized, meaning it works with values 0 to 1
If you say setUV(0.5, 0.25), for example, it will scroll by half of your texture width to the right, and one fourth of the texture width downwards
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_uv:
Gets the UV of this part
This function is normalized, meaning it will return values between 0 to 1
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_uv_pixels:
Sets the UV of this part in pixels
Automatically divides by the results of getTextureSize(), so you can just input the number of pixels you want the UV to scroll by
Errors if the part has multiple different-sized textures
If this part is a Group, it will attempt to setUVPixels on its children
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_uv_pixels:
Gets the UV of this part
Automatically multiplies the result by getTextureSize()
Errors if the part has multiple different-sized textures of if the part is a Group
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_uv_matrix:
Sets the UV matrix of this part
This matrix is applied to all UV points during the transform, with the UVs treated as homogeneous vectors
setUV() and setUVPixels() are actually just simpler ways of setting this matrix
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_uv_matrix: Gets the UV matrix of this part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_color:
Sets the color multiplier for this part for primary and secondary colors
Values are RGB from 0 to 1
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_color:
Returns the average set color from this part, as adding the primary color with the secondary, then dividing them
Values are RGB from 0 to 1
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_primary_color:
Sets the primary color multiplier for this part
Values are RGB from 0 to 1
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_primary_color:
Gets the primary color multiplier of this part
Values are RGB from 0 to 1
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_secondary_col:
Sets the secondary color multiplier for this part
Values are RGB from 0 to 1
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_secondary_col:
Gets the secondary color multiplier of this part
Values are RGB from 0 to 1
