en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_opacity:
Sets the opacity multiplier of this part
Note that opacity settings will only take effect if the part has a suitable Render Type for them, mainly TRANSLUCENT
Check out modelPart.setPrimaryRenderType() for how to do this
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_opacity:
Gets the opacity multiplier of this part
Note that opacity settings will only take effect if the part has a suitable Render Type for them, mainly TRANSLUCENT
Check out modelPart.setPrimaryRenderType() for how to do this
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_light:
Sets the light level to be used when rendering this part
Values you give are 0 to 15, indicating the block light and sky light levels you want to use
Passing nil will reset the lighting override for this part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_light:
Gets the light level you set earlier to this part
Does not interact with Minecraft's lighting system, only retrieving values you set earlier with setLight()
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_overlay:
Sets the overlay color to be used when rendering this part
Values you give are 0 to 15, indicating the white overlay and the damage overlay levels you want to use
Passing nil will reset the overlay override for this part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_overlay:
Gets the overlay color you set earlier to this part
Does not interact with Minecraft's overlay system, only retrieving values you set earlier with setOverlay()
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.set_parent_type:
Sets the parent type of the part
See the ParentType parts in the list docs for legal types
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_parent_type: Returns the current parent type of the part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_type: Returns whether this part is a "GROUP", a "CUBE", or a "MESH"
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.override_vanilla_: Returns if this part vanilla rotation is being overridden by an animation
Returns if this part vanilla position is being overridden by an animation
Returns if this part vanilla scale is being overridden by an animation
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.new_text: Adds a new Text Render Task on this part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.new_item: Adds a new Item Render Task on this part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.new_block: Adds a new Block Render Task on this part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.new_sprite: Adds a new Sprite Render Task on this part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_task:
Gets the Render Task with the given name from this part
Returns a table with all tasks if a name is not given
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.remove_task:
Removes the Task with the given name from this part
Removes ALL tasks if a name is not given
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_vertices:
Return a table with all vertices from the given texture id
Returns nil if no vertices was found
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.get_all_vertices: Return a table of all texture ids and its vertices
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.move_to: Moves this part to be a child of the given part
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.add_child: Adds the given part into this part's children list
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.remove_child: Removes the given part from this part's children list
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.copy:
Returns a copy of this part, with all customizations and vertices copied
Children parts are passed as reference, in a new list
en_us.figura.docs.model_part.new_part:
Creates a new, empty, group model part as a child of this part, at the same pivot point
Takes two arguments, the new part's name and optionally its parent type
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate: A global API which is used for customizing your player's nameplate in chat, above your head, and in the tab list
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate.chat: A customization for your nameplate in the chat
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate.entity: A customization for your nameplate above your head
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate.list: A customization for your nameplate in the tab list
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate.all: A group that manage all your nameplate customizations at once
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_customization: A customization that can be applied to a nameplate
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_customization.get_: The text to use in this nameplate
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_customization.set_: The text to use in this nameplate
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity: A nameplate customization that is specialized for entities
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.get_pivot: Gets the pivot of the nameplate, in world coordinates
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.set_pivot: Sets the pivot of the nameplate, in world coordinates
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.get_pos: Gets the position offset of the nameplate, in world coordinates
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.set_pos: Sets the position offset of the nameplate, in world coordinates
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.get_scale: Gets scale factor of the nameplate
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.set_scale: Sets the scale factor of the nameplate
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.get_backgro: Gets the set color of the nameplate background
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.set_backgro:
Sets the color of the nameplate background
If the alpha value is not given, it will uses the vanilla value (as in the accessibility settings)
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.set_outline: Sets the color used for the outline in the outline mode
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.set_light:
Sets the light override value
Values are given from 0 to 15, indicating the block light and sky light levels you want to use
Passing nil will reset the lighting override
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.is_visible: Gets whether or not the nameplate should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.set_visible: Sets whether or not the nameplate should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.has_shadow: Gets whether or not the nameplate should have shadow
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.set_shadow:
Sets whether or not the nameplate should have shadow
Incompatible with "outline"
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.has_outline: Gets whether or not the nameplate should have outline
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_entity.set_outline:
Sets whether or not the nameplate should have outline
Incompatible with "shadow"
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_group: A customization that holds another nameplate customizations
en_us.figura.docs.nameplate_group.set_text: Sets the text for all its children customizations
en_us.figura.docs.particles:
A global API which is used for dealing with Minecraft's particles
Particles instances are created when indexing their id
Accessed using the name "particles"
en_us.figura.docs.particles.new_particle:
Creates a particle with the given name at the specified position, with the given velocity
Some particles have special properties, like the "dust" particle
For these particles, the special properties can be put into the "name" parameter, the same way as it works for commands
en_us.figura.docs.particles.remove_particles: Removes all particles spawned from this avatar
en_us.figura.docs.particles.is_present: Checks if this particle id is registered
en_us.figura.docs.particle:
Represents a particle that can be spawned and modified
Obtained by indexing the ParticleAPI
Exists as an object-oriented alternative to particles:addParticle()
en_us.figura.docs.particle.spawn: Spawns this particle with the current properties
en_us.figura.docs.particle.remove: Removes this particle from the world
en_us.figura.docs.particle.is_alive: Checks if this particle is not flagged for removal
en_us.figura.docs.particle.set_pos:
Sets this particle position
The position is given in world coordinates
en_us.figura.docs.particle.get_velocity: Gets the velocity of this particle
en_us.figura.docs.particle.set_velocity:
Sets the velocity of this particle
The velocity is given in world coordinates
en_us.figura.docs.particle.set_color:
Sets this particle color
Accepts and alpha value, but most particles do not supports it
Default rgba of 1
en_us.figura.docs.particle.set_lifetime: Sets this particle lifetime, which is how many ticks this particle should stay in the world
en_us.figura.docs.particle.has_physics: Gets if this particle has physics
en_us.figura.docs.particle.set_physics: Sets if this particle has physics
en_us.figura.docs.pings: A global API dedicated to register and call pings
en_us.figura.docs.ping_function: A custom function wrapped with networking data
en_us.figura.docs.render_task:
Represents a rendering task for Figura to complete each frame
An abstract superclass of ItemTask, BlockTask, and TextTask
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.remove: Removes this render task from the parent model part
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.is_visible: Checks if this task is visible
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.set_visible: Sets whether or not this task should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.get_light: Returns the light override value of this task
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.set_light:
Sets the light override value of this task
Values are given from 0 to 15, indicating the block light and sky light levels you want to use
Passing nil will reset the lighting override for this task
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.get_overlay: Returns the overlay override value of this task
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.set_overlay:
Sets the overlay override value of this task
Values you give are 0 to 15, indicating the white overlay and the damage overlay levels you want to use
Passing nil will reset the overlay override for this task
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.set_pos:
Sets the position of the task, relative with its attached part
Uses model coordinates
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.set_rot: Sets the rotation of the task, relative with its attached part
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.set_scale: Sets the scale of the task, relative with its attached part
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.get_position_mat: Recalculates the matrix for this render task, based on its current position, rotation, scale, and pivot, then returns this matrix

Returns the position matrix for this render task
The Raw version of the function is different in that it doesn't recalculate the matrix before getting it
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.get_normal_matri: Recalculates the normal matrix for this render task, based on its current position, rotation, scale, and pivot, then returns this matrix

Returns the normal matrix for this render task
The Raw version of the function is different in that it doesn't recalculate the matrix before returning it
en_us.figura.docs.render_task.set_matrix:
Sets the given matrix as the position matrix for this render task
The normal matrix is automatically calculated as the inverse transpose of this matrix
Calling this DOES NOT CHANGE the values of position, rot, or scale in the render task
If you call setPos() or a similar function, the effects of setMatrix() will be overwritten
en_us.figura.docs.item_task: A task for rendering an Item
en_us.figura.docs.item_task.set_item: Sets the Item for this task render
en_us.figura.docs.item_task.get_display_mode: Gets this task item display mode
en_us.figura.docs.item_task.set_display_mode: Sets the item display mode for this task
en_us.figura.docs.block_task: A task for rendering a Block
en_us.figura.docs.block_task.set_block: Sets the Block for this task render
en_us.figura.docs.text_task: A task for rendering some Text
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.get_text: Returns the Text from this task
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_text: Sets the Text for this task render
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_alignment:
Sets this Text alignment
Can be either "LEFT", "RIGHT" or "CENTER"
Default "LEFT"
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.has_shadow: Checks if this task text has shadow
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_shadow:
Toggles if the Text should render with a drop shadow
Not compatible with "Outline" mode
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.has_outline: Checks if this task text has outline
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_outline:
Toggles if the Text should render with a outline
Always renders at full bright
Not compatible with "Shadow" and "Emissive" modes
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.get_outline_color: Gets this tasks text outline color
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_outline_color:
Sets the outline color this Text should render
Only compatible with "Outline" mode
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.get_width:
Gets this Text max width
Default 0
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_width:
Sets this Text max width, wrapping the text into multiple lines
Width of 0 or less do not wraps the text
Default 0
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.has_wrap: Check if this Text should wrap lines
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_wrap: Sets if this Text should wrap lines
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.is_see_through:
Check if this Text can be seen behind walls
Default false
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_see_through:
Sets if this Text can be seen behind walls
Default false
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.has_background:
Check if this Text should render its background
Default false
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_background:
Sets if this Text should render its background
Default false
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.get_background_col: Gets the this Text background color
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_background_col:
Sets the background colour of this Text
If the alpha value is not given, it will uses the vanilla value (as in the accessibility settings)
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.get_opacity: Gets the opacity of this text
en_us.figura.docs.text_task.set_opacity: Sets the opacity of this text
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task: A task for rendering a single Sprite
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.set_texture:
Sets this task's texture
The texture dimensions, Width and Height, must be provided if the texture is a location
For custom textures, the dimensions are optional
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.get_dimensions: Returns the texture dimensions, used in UV calculation
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.set_dimensions: Sets the texture dimensions, used in UV calculation
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.get_size: Returns the width and height used to render this sprite
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.set_size: Sets the width and height used to render this sprite
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.set_region:
Sets the texture UV region
Uses its dimensions to calculate the max UV
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.set_uv:
Sets this texture UV offset
The Region and Dimension are used to calculate the end UV
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.get_uv_pixels: Get this texture UV offset, in pixels, based on the texture's dimension
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.set_uv_pixels: Set this texture UV offset, in pixels, based on the texture's dimension
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.get_color:
Gets the current color multiplier of this sprite
Values are RGBA from 0 to 1
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.set_color:
Sets a color multiplier for this sprite
Values are RGBA from 0 to 1
Default values are 1, alpha is optional
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.get_render_type: Gets the name of the current render type for this sprite
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.set_render_type:
Sets the current render type of this sprite
TRANSLUCENT by default
Check the docs enum command for all render types
en_us.figura.docs.sprite_task.get_vertices:
Returns a table with all 4 vertices of this sprite
Changing the values through other functions will reset those vertices
en_us.figura.docs.renderer: A global API providing functions that change the way Minecraft renders your player
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.render_fire:
Whether or not you should visually have the fire effect while on fire
True by default
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.render_vehicle:
Whether or not your vehicle (boat, minecart, horse, whatever) will be rendered
True by default
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.render_crosshair:
Toggles whether or not if your crosshair should render
True by default
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.force_paperdoll:
Toggles if the paperdoll should render regardless of the player doing an action
If the paperdoll is disabled, or set to always render, nothing will change
False by default
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.render_hud:
Toggles whether or not the vanilla HUD should be rendered
Hands and the Figura HUD are not included
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.should_render_fire: Checks if the fire effect should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_render_fire: Sets if the fire effect should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.should_render_vehic: Check if your vehicle should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_render_vehicle: Sets if your vehicle should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.should_render_cross: Check if your crosshair should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_render_crosshai: Sets if your crosshair should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.should_force_paperd: Check if the paperdoll should forcefully be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_force_paperdoll: Sets if the paperdoll should forcefully be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.should_render_hud: Check if the vanilla HUD should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_render_hud: Sets if the vanilla HUD should be rendered
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.is_upside_down: Checks if this entity should be rendered upside down
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_upside_down: Sets if this entity will be rendered upside down
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_shadow_radius:
Sets the radius of your shadow
The default value is nil, which means to use the vanilla default of 0.5 for players
The maximum value is 12
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_shadow_radius: Gets the radius of your shadow
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.is_first_person: Checks if your camera is in the first person view
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.is_camera_backwards: Checks if your camera is in the backwards third person view
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_camera_pos: Gets the position offset for the camera
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_camera_pos:
Sets the position offset for the camera
Nil values for position are assumed to be 0
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_camera_pivot: Gets the absolute pivot for the camera
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_camera_pivot:
Sets the absolute pivot for the camera
The pivot will also move the camera
Its values are relative to the World
Nil values for pivot are assumed to be 0
For relative rotation values, check out the "offset" pivot function
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_camera_offset_p: Gets the offset pivot for the camera
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_offset_camera_p:
Sets the offset pivot for the camera
The pivot will also move the camera
Its values are relative to the world
Nil values for pivot are assumed to be 0
For relative rotation values, check out the non-offset pivot function
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_camera_rot: Gets the absolute rotation of the camera
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_camera_rot:
Sets the absolute rotation of the camera
The position is not taken into account for roll
Nil values for rotation are assumed to be 0
For relative rotation values, check out the "offset" rot function
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_camera_offset_r: Gets the offset rotation for the camera
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_offset_camera_r:
Sets the offset rotation for the camera
Nil values for rotation are assumed to be 0
Angles are given in degrees
For absolute rotation values, check out the non-offset rot function
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_camera_matrix: Sets the camera matrix with the given matrix
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_camera_normal: Returns the modified camera normal matrix
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_camera_normal: Sets the camera normal matrix with the given matrix
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_post_effect:
Sets the current rendering effect
Same as the discontinued Super Secret Settings
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_fov: Gets the multiplier of your fov
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_fov:
Sets the multiplier of your fov
The default value is nil, which means no changes will be applied to your fov
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_crosshair_offse: Gets the offset of your crosshair
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_crosshair_offse: Sets the offset of your crosshair
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_outline_color: Gets the custom glowing effect's outline color
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_outline_color: Sets the custom glowing effect's outline color
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_primary_fire_te: Gets the current custom primary fire texture
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_secondary_fire_: Gets the current custom secondary fire texture
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_primary_fire_te:
Sets a custom primary fire texture, to render while the entity is on fire
The effect is compound by two layers
The secondary layer is what renders in first person
The absence of a secondary layer uses the primary layer as fallback
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_secondary_fire_:
Sets a custom secondary fire texture, to render while the entity is on fire
The effect is compound by two layers
The secondary layer is what renders in first person
The absence of a secondary layer uses the primary layer as fallback
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_render_left_arm: Toggle if the left arm should be rendered in first person, regardless if you are holding an item or not
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_render_left_arm: Gets if the left arm should be rendered while in first person
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_render_right_ar: Toggle if the right arm should be rendered in first person, regardless if you are holding an item or not
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_render_right_ar: Gets if the right arm should be rendered while in first person
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_eye_offset: Sets an offset for the entity eye position, altering the targeted block and entity
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_eye_offset:
Returns the offset for the entity eye position
Default nil
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.set_block_outline_c:
Sets the color of the selected block outline
Default alpha is 0.4
Might not be compatible with shaders
en_us.figura.docs.renderer.get_block_outline_c:
Returns the set color for the selected block outline
Default nil
en_us.figura.docs.sounds:
A global API which is used to play Minecraft sounds
Accessed using the name "sounds"
en_us.figura.docs.sounds.play_sound:
Plays the specified sound at the specified position with the given volume and pitch multipliers
The sound id is either an identifier or the custom sound name
Volume in Minecraft refers to how far away people can hear the sound from, not the actual loudness of it
If you don't give values for volume and pitch, the default values are 1
en_us.figura.docs.sounds.stop_sound:
Stops the playing sounds from this avatar
If an id is specified, it only stops the sounds from that id
en_us.figura.docs.sounds.new_sound:
Registers a new custom sound for this avatar
The first argument is the sound id while the second argument is either a byte array of the sound data, or a base64 string representation of the same
en_us.figura.docs.sounds.is_present: Checks if this sound id is registered either by custom avatar sounds or a vanilla sound
en_us.figura.docs.sounds.get_custom_sounds: Returns a table with all registered custom sounds ids
en_us.figura.docs.sound:
Represents a sound that can be played
Obtained by indexing the SoundAPI
Exists as an object-oriented alternative to sounds:playSound()
en_us.figura.docs.sound.play: Plays this sound, or resume a paused sound
en_us.figura.docs.sound.is_playing: Checks if this sound is being played
en_us.figura.docs.sound.pause: Pauses the current playback of this sound
en_us.figura.docs.sound.stop: Stops the playback of this sound
en_us.figura.docs.sound.set_pos:
Sets the position of this sound
Position is given in world coordinates
Default 0
en_us.figura.docs.sound.set_volume:
Sets the volume of this sound
Default 1
en_us.figura.docs.sound.set_attenuation:
Sets the attenuation of this sound
Default 1
en_us.figura.docs.sound.set_pitch:
Sets the pitch of this sound
Default 1
en_us.figura.docs.sound.is_looping: Checks if this sound is looping
en_us.figura.docs.sound.set_loop:
Toggles if this sound should loop
Default false
en_us.figura.docs.sound.get_subtitle: Gets the subtitle text from this sound
en_us.figura.docs.sound.set_subtitle: Sets the subtitle text of this sound
en_us.figura.docs.textures: A global API which allows for creating textures at runtime
en_us.figura.docs.textures.new_texture:
Creates a new texture with the given name, width and height
The texture is filled with a solid color
en_us.figura.docs.textures.read: Reads a texture from a base64 string or a byte array
en_us.figura.docs.textures.copy:
Creates a copy of the texture
The copy is registered with the given name
en_us.figura.docs.textures.get: Gets a registered texture based on its name, or nil if no texture was found with that name
en_us.figura.docs.textures.get_textures:
Returns a table with all textures used by this avatar
Do not include generated textures from this API
en_us.figura.docs.textures.from_vanilla: Returns a copy of a resource texture as a texture object for modifying
en_us.figura.docs.texture: A texture object, either generated by the model or created with the TextureAPI
en_us.figura.docs.texture.get_path: Returns this texture resource path location
en_us.figura.docs.texture.get_dimensions: Returns a vector of this texture width and height
en_us.figura.docs.texture.get_pixel: Gets the RGBA color from the specified pixel
en_us.figura.docs.texture.set_pixel: Sets the RGBA color of the specified pixel
en_us.figura.docs.texture.fill: Sets the RGBA color of the entire specified region
en_us.figura.docs.texture.update: Updates the texture to the gpu, applying all the changes
en_us.figura.docs.texture.restore: Restores the texture to its original state, before any modifications
en_us.figura.docs.texture.save: Returns a base64 string representation of this texture
en_us.figura.docs.texture.apply_func:
Calls the given function on the specified area of this texture, it will iterate over each pixel, and their current x, y and color will be given as arguments, the color in a RGBA vec4 format, and the return value will set that pixel color
Invalid return values or nil takes no effects
en_us.figura.docs.texture.apply_matrix: Transforms all pixels in the specified area of this texture by the matrix
en_us.figura.docs.texture_atlas: A texture atlas object, with helper functions related to a texture atlas
en_us.figura.docs.texture_atlas.list_sprites: Returns a table with all sprite paths under this atlas
en_us.figura.docs.texture_atlas.get_sprite_uv:
Returns a vec4 containing the UV of the given sprite
The UV is ordered as U0, V0, U1, V1
en_us.figura.docs.texture_atlas.get_width: Returns the width of this atlas
en_us.figura.docs.texture_atlas.get_height: Returns the height of this atlas
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model:
A global API that provides functions to interact with the vanilla player model and its parts
Accessed using the name "vanilla_model"
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.head: The head of the player, not including the hat
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.body: The body of the player, not including the outer layer
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.left_arm: The left arm of the player, not including the outer layer
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.right_arm: The right arm of the player, not including the outer layer
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.left_leg: The left leg of the player, not including the outer layer
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.right_leg: The right leg of the player, not including the outer layer
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.hat: The outer layer of the player's head
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.jacket: The outer layer of the player's body
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.left_sleeve: The outer layer of the player's left arm
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.right_sleeve: The outer layer of the player's right arm
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.left_pants: The outer layer of the player's left leg
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.right_pants: The outer layer of the player's right leg
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.fake_cape: A custom copy of the cape, as attempt of storing its transformations since vanilla cape math is... weird
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.helmet_item: The item on the armor head slot
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.helmet_head: The head of the helmet model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.helmet_hat: The hat of the helmet model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.chestplate_bod: The body of the chestplate model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.chestplate_lef: The left arm of the chestplate model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.chestplate_rig: The right arm of the chestplate model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.leggings_body: The body of the leggings model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.leggings_left_: The left leg of the leggings model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.leggings_right: The right leg of the leggings model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.boots_left_leg: The left boot of the boots model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.boots_right_le: The right boot of the boots model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.left_elytra: The left wing of the elytra model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.right_elytra: The right wing of the elytra model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.held_items: Multi-part: Items in the player's hands
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.left_item: The item in the player's left hand
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.right_item: The item in the player's right hand
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.parrots: Multi-part: Parrots on the player's shoulders
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.left_parrot: The Parrot in the player's left shoulder
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.right_parrot: The Parrot in the player's right shoulder
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.all: Multi-part: The entirety of the vanilla model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.outer_layer: Multi-part: The outer layer of the player
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.inner_layer: Multi-part: The main body of the player, everything except the outer layer
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.armor: Multi-part: All armor on the model
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model.player: Multi-part: Both the outer and inner layers of the player's skin, as well as the cape
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_part:
An abstract superclass for vanilla model parts and groups
This part can be transformed similar to custom model parts, however not with the same extent
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_part.get_visible: Gets whether you have set this part to be visible or invisible
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_part.set_visible: Sets this part to be visible or invisible
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_part.get_pos:
Get this part's set position
Returns the value set by the "set" function
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_part.set_pos: Set this part's position, preserving the previous values
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_part.get_rot:
Get this part's set rotation
Returns the value set by the "set" function
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_part.set_offset_rot: Offsets this part's rotation, adding on top of the vanilla values
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_part.get_scale:
Get this part's set scale
Returns the value set by the "set" function
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_part.set_offset_scal: Offsets this part's scale, multiplying with the vanilla values
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model_part:
Represents a model part in a vanilla model
Can be queried for vanilla transform values
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_model_part.get_origi: Gets if this vanilla model part is visible or not, without interference from your script
Gets the rotation to this vanilla model part currently applied by Minecraft
Gets the position offset to this vanilla model part currently applied by Minecraft
Gets the scale to this vanilla model part currently applied by Minecraft
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_group_part:
Represents a group of model parts in a vanilla model
Used for easy reference of normal parts
All changes also applies to all children parts
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_group_part.set_visib: Sets this part and its children to be visible or invisible
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_group_part.set_pos: Set this part and its children's position, preserving the previous values
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_group_part.set_rot: Set this part and its children's rotation
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_group_part.set_offse: Offsets this part and its children's rotation, adding on top of the vanilla values
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_group_part.set_scale: Set this part and its children's scale
en_us.figura.docs.vanilla_group_part.set_offse: Offsets this part and its children's scale, multiplying with the vanilla values
en_us.figura.docs.vectors:
A global API which provides functions dedicated to creating and otherwise manipulating vectors
Accessed using the name "vectors"
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.vec:
Creates and returns a vector of the appropriate size to hold the arguments passed in
For example, if you call vec(3, 4, 0, 2), then the function will return a Vector4 containing those values
There is a global alias "vec" for this function, meaning the "vectors." can be omitted
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.vec2:
Creates and returns a Vector2 with the given values
Nil values become zero
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.vec3:
Creates and returns a Vector3 with the given values
Nil values become zero
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.vec4:
Creates and returns a Vector4 with the given values
Nil values become zero
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.rgb_to_int: Converts the given color from RGB format to Integer format
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.int_to_rgb: Converts the given color from Integer format to RGB format
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.hex_to_rgb:
Parses a Hex string color into a RGB format vector
The hex "#" is optional, and it can have any length, however only the first 6 hex digits are evaluated, short hex (length 3) is also supported
For example, "#42" is the same as "420000", and "F0B" is the same as "FF00BB"
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.hsv_to_rgb: Converts the given color from HSV format to RGB format
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.rgb_to_hsv: Converts the given color from RGB format to HSV format
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.rgb_to_hex:
Converts the given color from RGB format to Hex format
The "#" is not included on the return value
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.rotate_around_axis: Rotates a vector relative to a rotation vector
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.to_camera_space: Converts a position in the world into a position relative to the viewer's camera
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.world_to_screen_spac: Converts a position in the world into a position relative to the viewer's screen
en_us.figura.docs.vectors.angle_to_dir: Converts a pitch/yaw angle (in degrees) into a direction vector
en_us.figura.docs.vector2:
A vector that holds 2 numbers
Can be created using functions in the "vectors" api
en_us.figura.docs.vector3:
A vector that holds 3 numbers
Can be created using functions in the "vectors" api
en_us.figura.docs.vector4:
A vector that holds 4 numbers
Can be created using functions in the "vectors" api
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.x:
The first coordinate of this vector
Can also be gotten with the indices "r" and [1]
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.y:
The second coordinate of this vector
Can also be gotten with the indices "g" and [2]
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.z:
The third coordinate of this vector
Can also be gotten with the indices "b" and [3]
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.w:
The fourth coordinate of this vector
Can also be gotten with the indices "a" and [4]
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.reset: Resets this vector back to being all zeroes, and returns itself for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.set:
Sets this vector to have the given values
Nil values are treated as zero
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.add: Adds the given vector or values to this one, and returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.sub: Subtracts the given vector or values from this one, and returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.offset: Offsets this vector by the given factor, adding the factor to all components, and returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.mul: Multiplies the given vector or values into this one, and returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.div: Divides this vector by the given vector or values, and returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.reduce: Reduces this vector modulo the given vector or values, and returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.scale: Scales this vector by the given factor, and returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.unpack: Returns each of this vector values as argument
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.transform: Transforms this vector by the given matrix, and returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.length_squared:
Returns the length of this vector squared
Suitable when you only care about relative lengths, because it avoids a square root
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.copy: Creates and returns a copy of this vector
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.dot: Returns the dot product of this vector with the other
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.normalize:
Modifies this vector so that its length is 1, unless its length was originally 0
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.normalized: Returns a copy of this vector with length 1, unless its length was originally 0
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.clamp_length:
Modifies this vector so that its length is between minLength and maxLength
If the vector has length zero, it is unmodified
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.clamped:
Returns a modified copy of this vector, with its length clamped from minLength to maxLength
If the vector has length zero, then the copy does too
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.length: Returns the length of this vector
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.to_rad: Returns a copy of this vector, in radians
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.to_deg: Returns a copy of this vector, in degrees
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.floor: Returns a copy of this vector with its values rounded down
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.ceil: Returns a copy of this vector with its values rounded up
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.apply_func:
Calls the given function on each element of this vector, and sets the values of the vector to the returns
The current index and its value is given as arguments of the function
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector_n.augmented:
Returns the augmented form of this vector
The augmented form is a Vector of the same length + 1
The new axis will have the given value, or 1 when it is not specified
en_us.figura.docs.vector3.cross:
Sets this vector to the cross product of itself and the other vector
Returns self for chaining
en_us.figura.docs.vector3.crossed: Returns a new vector which is the cross product of this and the other one
en_us.figura.docs.vertex.get_pos: Returns the position vector of this vertex
en_us.figura.docs.vertex.set_pos: Sets the position vector of this vertex
en_us.figura.docs.vertex.get_uv: Returns the UV vector of this vertex
en_us.figura.docs.vertex.set_uv: Sets the UV vector of this vertex
en_us.figura.docs.vertex.get_normal: Returns the normal vector of this vertex
en_us.figura.docs.vertex.set_normal: Sets the normal vector of this vertex
en_us.figura.docs.world:
A global API dedicated to reading information from the Minecraft world
Accessed using the name "world"
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_biome: Gets the Biome located at the given position
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_block_state: Gets the BlockState of the block at the given position
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_blocks:
Gets a list of all BlockStates in the specified area
The maximum area size is 8 x 8 x 8
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_redstone_power: Gets the redstone power level of the block at the given position
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_strong_redstone_po: Gets the direct redstone power level of the block at the given position
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_time:
Gets the current game time of the world
If delta is passed in, then it adds delta to the time
The default value of delta is zero
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_time_of_day:
Gets the current day time of the world
If delta is passed in, then it adds delta to the time
The default value of delta is zero
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_moon_phase: Gets the current moon phase of the world, stored as an integer
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_rain_gradient:
Gets the current rain gradient in the world, interpolated from the previous tick to the current one
The default value of delta is 1, which is the current tick
en_us.figura.docs.world.is_thundering: Gets whether or not there is currently thunder/lightning happening in the world
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_light_level: Gets the overall light level of the block at the given position
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_sky_light_level: Gets the sky light level of the block at the given position
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_block_light_level: Gets the block light level of the block at the given position
en_us.figura.docs.world.is_open_sky: Gets whether or not the sky is open at the given position
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_dimension: Gets the dimension name of this world
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_entity: Returns an EntityAPI object from this UUID's entity, or nil if no entity was found
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_players:
Returns a table containing instances of Player for all players in the world
The players are indexed by their names
en_us.figura.docs.world.avatar_vars:
Returns a table containing variables stored from all loaded Avatars "avatar:store()" function
The table will be indexed by the avatar's owner UUID
en_us.figura.docs.world.new_block:
Parses and create a new BlockState from the given string
A world position can be optionally given for the blockstate functions that relies on its position
en_us.figura.docs.world.new_item:
Parses and create a new ItemStack from the given string
A count and damage can be given, to be applied on this itemstack
en_us.figura.docs.world.exists:
Checks whether or not a world currently exists
This will almost always be true, but might be false on some occasions such as while travelling between dimensions
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_build_height: Returns the minimum and maximum build height of the world, as varargs
en_us.figura.docs.world.get_spawn_point: Returns a vector with the coordinates of the world spawn
